US forces believed they had him cornered in 2001, but he slipped into Pakistan.  Kiriakou also revealed early Al-Qaeda-Lashkar-e-Taiba links and Pakistan's complex role in counterterrorism efforts.

title: Why more people are exchanging gold jewellery instead of buying?
description: Soaring gold prices are transforming the festive season into a gold exchange bonanza across India. Shoppers are increasingly trading old jewellery for new pieces, with exchanges now forming a significant portion of sales for major retailers. This trend, driven by rising prices impacting purchasing power, is particularly strong in northern, western, and eastern regions.

title: Cognizant hiring: CEO says Arts graduates wanted not CS; here's his reason why

Kumar tells Fortune that AI creates entry-level opportunities by amplifying human potential rather than displacing workers. He advises students to focus on interdisciplinary skills, combining fields like history with computational abilities. The CEO emphasizes that as AI makes expertise accessible, applying intelligence becomes more valuable than specialisation, with faster paths to expertise for graduates who leverage AI tools effectively.

'Hraam... hreem... hruuum': Bengaluru's ‘ghost-chasing’ sorcerer faces police case
description: A Bengaluru sorcerer, Srinivas Swami, faces police action for disturbing neighbours with midnight rituals and loud music. After a complaint, he allegedly cursed a neighbour, threatening her with death. The court has ordered a case registered under the Black Magic Act, with police investigating the threats and alleged assault. Authorities warn against late-night noise and encourage cooperation in such investigations.

title: UP madrassa sought ‘virginity certificate’ from 13-year-old for admission
description: A Moradabad madrassa official was arrested after a father alleged his 13-year-old daughter was denied admission without a "virginity certificate." The school's admission in-charge and principal reportedly demanded a medical test, abused the student's mother, and took money for a transfer certificate that was never issued. An FIR has been filed under relevant sections of the law.

title: Delhi prepares for Chhath: With rain over, froth back in Yamuna; pollution rises
description: The aftermath of the monsoon has unveiled troubling pollution levels in Delhi's Yamuna River, with frothing reemerging alongside a troubling spike in faecal coliform and BOD metrics. In a bid to combat this issue, authorities have made efforts to beautify the ghats for Chhath festivities and orchestrated water releases from Haryana. However, environmentalists emphasize that these measures are merely stopgaps.

title: Kolkata hotel: Foul smell leads to discovery of decomposed body inside bed
description: A family checking into a Kolkata hotel discovered a decomposed body hidden in a storage bed after complaining of a pungent smell. The victim, identified as 26-year-old Rahul Lal, had checked in with two other men who later left. Preliminary reports indicate strangulation as the cause of death.

title: 'Singh Organization': 11 Indian-origin men charged in California for major cargo theft
UP horror: Man shoots son dead, critically injures bahu for ‘neglecting him’
description: A 68-year-old man in Muzaffarnagar, feeling neglected after his wife's death, shot his son dead and critically injured his daughter-in-law following an argument. The accused, Brijveer Sehrawat, used a licensed gun in the fatal incident. His grandson filed a complaint, leading to Brijveer's arrest.

title: Kash Patel says he decides which arrest to make; Social media trolls him over Epstein
description: FBI Director Kash Patel vehemently denied claims that President Trump orchestrated the NBA gambling bust due to player activism. Patel asserted his sole authority over arrest decisions, dismissing the suggestion as "dumbest thing I've ever heard." Social media users trolled him, saying he couldn't make any arrests in the Epstein or Diddy case whatsoever.

title: Eating too much honey may lower blood pressure - Here's how
description: Honey offers potential heart benefits, including a possible reduction in systolic blood pressure due to its antioxidants and minerals that aid blood vessel function. However, excessive consumption can lead to weight gain and elevated blood sugar. Experts advise moderation, suggesting 1-2 teaspoons daily as a replacement for refined sugar, and cautioning individuals with diabetes or those on medication.

title: ‘Not robust enough’: Airbnb CEO says ChatGPT can’t yet power platform; hints at future use
description: Airbnb CEO Brian Chesky expressed interest in integrating OpenAI's ChatGPT, but found its current SDK insufficient for their needs. While Airbnb already uses AI, the trend favors customizable open-source models, with Chinese tech giants like Alibaba leading the charge by releasing advanced, cost-effective systems and fostering a vast open-source AI ecosystem.
